intro: Jardinea abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. It features a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
